alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Phillips County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washington, southeastern Logan and southwestern Phillips Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 436 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Fleming to 7 miles southwest of Burdett, or along a line extending from 15 miles east of Sterling to 11 miles northeast of Akron. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fleming, St Petersburg, Lone Star and Burdett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Phillips County; Washington County
